title: Chamoli: Land of Gods
short_description: The gateway to Badrinath and home to ancient temples like Gopeshwar.
long_description:
Chamoli is not just a town but a district in Uttarakhand widely known as the 'Abode of Gods'. It is the heart of the Garhwal Himalayas, housing Badrinath, Hemkund Sahib, and the Valley of Flowers. However, Chamoli town (Gopeshwar) itself is a significant spiritual center.

The centerpiece is the Gopinath Temple in Gopeshwar, built between the 9th and 11th centuries. It is arguably the only temple where Lord Shiva is worshipped as 'Nirgun' (formless) in a swayambhu lingam, and unique because no milk or water is poured on itâ€”only Bel Patra (leaves). The temple's trishul (trident) is made of eight different metals and dates back to the 12th century; legend says mere mortals cannot move it.

Chamoli is also the base for the Panch Kedar trek to Tungnath (the world's highest Shiva temple) and Rudranath. The Alaknanda river slices through the district, creating deep, dramatic gorges.
spiritual_significance: Home to the Gopinath Temple (Shiva). It is the headquarters for major pilgrimages. The region is associated with the Chipko Movement (environmental spirituality).

major_temples_and_sites.name: Gopinath Temple
major_temples_and_sites.description: An ancient temple in Gopeshwar dedicated to Shiva. Famous for its 5m tall trident.

major_temples_and_sites.name: Tungnath
major_temples_and_sites.description: World's highest Shiva temple (3,680m), reachable by a scenic 4km trek from Chopta (nearby).

major_temples_and_sites.name: Anusuya Devi Temple
major_temples_and_sites.description: Dedicated to Goddess Anusuya, synonymous with removing infertility and sorrow.

major_temples_and_sites.name: Rudranath
major_temples_and_sites.description: One of the Panch Kedars, where the face of Shiva is worshipped. Requires a tough trek.

major_temples_and_sites.name: Karnaprayag
major_temples_and_sites.description: Confluence of Alaknanda and Pindar rivers. Associated with Karna from Mahabharata.

rituals_and_experiences: Trek to Tungnath and Chandrashila peak for 360-degree Himalayan views.
Meditate in the forests of Chopta (Mini Switzerland).
highlights: The architectural beauty of Gopinath Temple.
The quiet, non-touristy vibe of Gopeshwar.
best_months: April to June and September to November.
how_to_reach: By Air: Dehradun Airport (220km). By Road: on the main Rishikesh-Badrinath highway.
stay_recommendations: Luxury: Resorts in Chopta. Spiritual: Temple Guest Houses. Budget: Hotels in Gopeshwar/Chamoli.
safety_tips: Roads are winding; carry motion sickness meds. Tungnath trek is steep but short.
sample_itinerary:
Day 1: Drive to Gopeshwar. Visit Gopinath Temple. Stay.
Day 2: Drive to Chopta (40km). Trek to Tungnath and Chandrashila. Return to Chopta or Gopeshwar.
